title: 5 takeaways from the Revolution’s season-opening defeat in Nashville
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution lost 4-1 to Nashville SC in their 2026 MLS season opener under new coach Marko Mitrović.
Three of New England's four projected starting defenders were unavailable, impacting team performance against Nashville.
Coach Mitrović faces challenges balancing team system implementation with achieving results in MLS games.

title: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station break down again
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station have been shut twice due to harsh winter conditions.
The gates, installed to reduce fare evasion, struggled against snow and bitterly cold winter wind.
The $3.3 million gates reportedly increased mTicket activations by 42% since opening, despite repeated shutdowns.

title: Watch: Jack Hughes delivers USA first Olympic gold medal in men’s hockey since 1980, team honors Johnny Gaudreau
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jack Hughes scored the game-winning goal in overtime, leading USA to a 2-1 victory over Canada in the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Team USA honored late Johnny Gaudreau during celebrations, inviting his children to join them on the ice with gold medals.
Boston Bruins players Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman won gold, marking the first Bruins Olympic gold medals since 2014.

title: After homering in spring training debut, could Andruw Monasterio play big role for Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Andruw Monasterio hit a home run in Red Sox' Grapefruit League opener against Twins' pitcher Justin Topa.
Monasterio impressed manager Alex Cora in spring training with his athleticism and versatility at infield positions.
Romy Gonzalez's injury opens up an opportunity for Monasterio to be Red Sox' primary platoon infielder for 2026.

title: MSP arrests Maine man after he allegedly crashed truck twice while on drugs
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Andrew Beaulieu, 30, from Carthage, Maine was arrested after crashing his truck twice while allegedly on drugs.
The crashes occurred at a rest area on Route 24 South in Bridgewater and later on Forge Road in Westport.
Beaulieu faces charges of drug possession and operating under the influence; court date is set for March 3.

title: Methuen woman searching for her wedding dress after dry cleaner mix-up
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Kathleen Shea Dunleavy discovered she had the wrong wedding gown for 15 years after a dry cleaner mix-up.
Dunleavy's gown, picked up from Deluxe Cleaners in 2010, features buttons, a flower detail, and 'KS' initials.
Dunleavy seeks public help via Facebook to locate her missing dress from the now-closed Methuen dry cleaner.

title: At Chevalier Theatre, Mavis Staples lives up to her legacy of joy and protest
author: Terence Cawley
bullets: Mavis Staples performed at Chevalier Theatre in Medford, combining gospel-soul roots with modern Americana influences.
At 86, Staples delivered a 12-song, 65-minute set, including classics like 'City in the Sky' and 'Freedom Highway'.
Staples balanced joy and protest themes, addressing social issues and encouraging 'good trouble' in her performance.

title: Here’s how the Red Sox plan on handling MLB’s new ABS challenging system
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Red Sox player Wilson Contreras successfully tested MLB's new ABS challenge system during spring training, winning a call on Saturday.
Alex Cora encourages Red Sox to embrace the ABS system, emphasizing the importance of using challenges strategically and successfully.
Under the new rules, each MLB team gets two challenges per game for ball and strike calls, with challenges kept if successful.

title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Red Sox pitcher Lucas Giolito, who opted out after 2025, remains unsigned as 2026 spring training begins.
Garrett Crochet, Red Sox ace, expressed surprise over Giolito's free agency, citing his 2025 performance as undervalued.
The Red Sox added pitchers Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez, likely ruling out Giolito's return to Boston.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are considering trade targets including Colts receiver Michael Pittman Jr. due to Indianapolis's cap issues.
Bears wide receiver DJ Moore and Jaguars WR Brian Thomas Jr. are also potential trade targets for the Patriots.
Patriots may look to improve their offensive line by trading for Jaguars' Walker Little amidst few available veterans.
